commit message:
Merge maintenance release v0.9.10.2.

Changes:
- Bugfixes #41, #49
- When coming back to player and menu drawer is open - close it

Download enhacment.

1. Old downloads are now loaded up after application starts.
2. There is a context menu for each download that allows:
- Playing the downloaded track using Jamendo player.
- Adding downloaded track to the current playlist.
- Deleting the download and related files.
3. If the track has been downloaded it will be played from sd
instead of being streamed. The downloaded track can be played
in offline mode.
-----
4. DownloadInterface has been substitued with DownloadManager, which
now provides interface for downloads.
5. The DownloadProvider has been implemented. It provides access to the
DownloadJobs through DownloadManager. It also handles storing
DownloadsJobs in the database.
6. Database has been updated and apropriate upadter has been implemented.
7. Communication between the DownloadActivity and DownloadManager has been
updated. It is no longer pulling the DownloadJobs data every second.

Added paginated retrieval of all Album's tracks. Introduced simple track caching for album.

When non-paginated getAlbumTracks() is called it performs paginated track retrieval using 10 tracks per page.

Tracks are now stored within Album instances - a binding between Album and its Tracks.
The Jamendo API implementation doesn't automatically store tracks in given Album.
This operation is still to be performed by caller of getAlbumTracks().
Simple fixes related to latest download changes.

Long Title Scrolling in Landscape/Horizontal Mode - feature implementation
Please check Bug: 51 - Long Title Scrolling in Landscape/Horizontal Mode

Scrobble to Last.fm/Libre.fm via Simple Last.FM Scrobbler

Added Simple Last.Fm Scrobbler to list of scrobbling applications.
Configuration settings to either enable/disable scrobbling
and select desired application.

Scrobbling to app is intent-based therefore if target application
is not available on the system there will be no error.

Gestures support for Jamendo.
Four gestures related to Player control has been added to
main Jamendo activities.
A preference has been added that allows, enabling/disabling
of gesture support.
